resources.string: A new way to use your phone

Get the Pro version to:

 - Unlock a second edge

 - Customize column count and row count of Grid favorites

 - Unlock support for icon packs

 - Pin shortcuts to Recent Apps

 - Auto-disable Swiftly Switch in full screen apps
Truy cập Shortcut yêu thích từ mọi nơi

Vui lòng kích hoạt thiết lập này. Thiết lập này giúp Swiftly switch thực thi các tính năng: điều hướng, menu nút nguồn, và kéo thanh thông báo trạng thái với một số thiết bị Samsung. Nếu bạn gặp vấn đề với hiệu năng hoặc pin bạn nên xem xét vô hiệu hóa thiết lập này.
Allow Swiftly Switch with admin permissions to enable the screen lock.
Using this shortcut requires setting Swiftly Switch as an administrator. This means that the app CAN NOT be uninstalled unless you disable the permission first.

Using this shortcut requires setting Swiftly Switch as an administrator. This means that the app CAN NOT be uninstalled unless you disable the permission first. Set Swiftly Switch as your Device Administrator at Settings -> Security -> Device Administrators
Nhấp vào đây để cấp quyền \"Thay đổi thiết lập\" cho Swiftly switch
Swiflty switch cần có quyền \"Thay đổi thiết lập\"
Vui lòng kích hoạt thiết lập Khả Năng Truy Cập cho Swiftly switch
This feature is only available for Android 6.0 and above. For lower Android versions, you can enable/disable the edges from the persistent notification.
Prevent the app from interfering with the keyboard
The backup file will be stored in your Google Drive. Please connect to your Google account and then choose the folder to upload.

Không thể xóa, đây là duy nhất

After 10 months of development, we proud to announce Journal it!, a journal/diary app that makes journaling on mobile easy and delightful. If you love Swiftly Switch, you probably gonna love Journal it! too!
Place a small set of your favorite shortcuts in a semi-circle manner

3. Thiết lập Khả năng truy cập
1. Thiết lập quyền Vẽ trên ứng dụng khác
By setting Swiftly Switch as your assistant app (instead of Google Now on Tap), you can enable/disable trigger edges at any time by long-pressing the home button.
2. Thiết lập quyền Truy Cập Sử Dụng
Lag when launching apps from the home screen

Swiftly Switch can\'t start apps within 5 seconds from the moment you return to the Home screen. This is the how Android limit services. It\'s not a problem if you return home using the in-app Home shortcut.
Why I can\'t uninstall the app on my device?

You can uninstall the app as other applications. If you have set the app to \"Device administrator\" (for the screen lock shortcut), you\'ll need to disable it first: Settings > Security > Phone administrator > disable the option for Swiftly Switch.
Closed apps do not disappear from recent apps list
Due to a limitation from Android 5.0, 3rd-party apps can only access the list of your recently used apps but not the list of currently running apps on your device.
How to automatically disable the app when playing games?
Go to \"More settings\" and turn on \"Disable in full screen apps\" or \"Disable in landscape mode\"

The persistent notification is needed to keep Swiftly Switch active in the background but you can hide it by blocking all of the notifications from Swiftly Switch. To hide it, tap the notification > Hide notification > Block notification.
Please try to turn on the option for Swiftly Switch in Dropzone Manager. Also turn on the option for Swiftly Switch in \"Protected Apps\" setting to keep it running in the background.
Please turn off the Deep Clear option in Setting. Deep Clear will stop all the background process once you exit the app.

On MIUI 7, you need to enable the "Display pop-up" permission to make it work. Go to Settings > Apps > Swiftly Switch > Permission > Display pop-up > restart the app. 

On MIUI 8, you need to lock the app in the recent apps screen and turn off the Background Restriction. To lock the app in the recent apps screen: Press the Recent button > Swipe down the overview picture that indicates Swiftly Switch > Tap the Lock icon.

 To turn off the Background restriction: Setting > Battery and performance > Manage apps battery usage > Choose Apps > Swiftly Switch > Tap on "No restrictions".

This is a security feature of Android 6.0 and above. It gets triggered when granting permissions to an app while a \"floating app\" (screen overlay) is running. When this happens, just trigger Swiftly Switch by swiping in from the edge - Swiftly Switch will automatically pause for 10 seconds so you can grant the permissions as normal. Alternatively, you can pause Swiftly Switch through the notification and resume it after you\'re done.
Why there is no shortcut for switching mobile network or airplane mode?
Due to restrictions from Android, Swiftly Switch does not have the authority to directly access and switch your mobile network or airplane mode.
\"Place a large set of your favorite shortcuts here. Tap to set size, content and position\"
How do you like the app?
Import shortcuts and settings from backup file
Choose the backup file from Google Drive.
Khởi chạy tức thì bị vô hiệu

This persistent notification is required for Swiftly Switch to stay active in the background. You may hide it by tapping and holding the notification and selecting "Block all notifications".

If you see the "Screen overlay detected" warning when giving a permission to another app, please pause Swiftly Switch temporarily using the "Pause" button on the notification.

Or just swipe in from the edge, Swiftly Switch will be paused for 10s automatically when you're in giving permission window.
Pause if you see the \"Screen Overlay Detected\". Tap here for more details.
Một hoặc nhiều thiết lập bị thiếu
Swiftly Switch: Auto-pause for 10s while granting permissions. Change this in Swiftly Switch settings.

Swiftly Switch needs the \"Write settings\" permission to perform this action. Please find Swiftly Switch in the device\'s app settings and enable the permission.
